title: Tampa General Hospital Enhances Heart Care with Cutting-Edge Imaging Technology
article: This new 512-slice CT scanner excels in advanced imaging, prioritizing speed, resolution and patient comfort. TAMPA, Fla., May 21, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Tampa General Hospital (TGH) is raising the bar for heart care with the addition of two GE Healthcare Revolution APEX 512-Slice computed tomography (CT) scanners. The advanced scanners leverage artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning technologies to deliver faster, clearer and more precise scans, refining diagnoses and treatments of cardiovascular diseases. Tampa General Hospital (TGH) is raising the bar for heart care with the addition of two GE Healthcare Revolution APEX 512-Slice computed tomography (CT) scanners. The advanced scanners leverage artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning technologies to deliver faster, clearer and more precise scans, refining diagnoses and treatments of cardiovascular diseases. The purchase of the scanners was made possible thanks to a generous gift by the Ferman family to the TGH Foundation. One is located at the TGH Ferman Family Imaging Center in Tampa General Hospital Diagnostic Imaging on the Davis Islands campus; the other is being used for inpatient examinations within the hospital itself. "This technology is a game-changer for cardiac imaging at Tampa General," remarked Dr. Shone Almeida, director of the Cardiac CT program at Tampa General and a faculty member of the USF Health Morsani College of Medicine. "With sharper images and faster scan times, we can diagnose heart disease with greater confidence, allowing cardiologists to make better treatment decisions and improve patient outcomes." The 512-slice CT scanner is a cornerstone of the TGH Cardiometabolic Disease Prevention Program, providing highly detailed images of the heart and coronary arteries. The program focuses on early detection, risk assessment and personalized interventions to prevent the progression of cardiovascular and metabolic diseases such as diabetes and obesity-related heart conditions. "The integration of this technology into our cardiometabolic program enables us to identify early signs of heart disease before symptoms arise, offering patients a chance to take preventive action," said Almeida who is also the medical director for the cardiometabolic program at Tampa General. This latest upgrade in cardiac imaging represents a collaborative effort between the TGH Heart & Vascular Institute and the academic health system's radiologists. The scanners feature the latest technological advancements, from deep learning-based image reconstruction to ultra-high-resolution imaging. "This investment supports our mission to bring world-class diagnostic technology to our patients," said Sherri Lewman, senior vice president of Enterprise Imaging at TGH. "By integrating AI-driven imaging, we're improving accuracy while enhancing patient safety and comfort." Designed to enhance cardiac imaging precision, the CT scanners offer exceptional speed, clarity and diagnostic precision. It allows physicians to assess coronary artery disease, structural heart conditions and other cardiovascular abnormalities in unparalleled detail. "This is a significant breakthrough; access to this top level of imaging enables our team of cardiologists to identify even the most complex conditions accurately," said Dr. Aarti Patel, co-director of the TGH Heart & Vascular Institute's Cardiovascular Imaging program, Cardiology and an associate professor in the Division of Cardiology, USF Health Morsani College of Medicine. "This information is crucial for developing personalized treatment plans that cater to each patient's unique needs, ultimately leading to improved long-term outcomes." "The 512-slice CT scanners significantly improve diagnostic accuracy and efficiency by providing high-definition images that facilitate precise interpretation," said Dr. Hristina Natcheva, co-director of the TGH Heart & Vascular Institute's Cardiovascular Imaging program, Cardiothoracic and an assistant professor, Department of Radiology, USF Health Morsani College of Medicine. "We can conduct highly detailed diagnostic exams, enabling more refined and comprehensive interpretations, strengthening our ability to detect and diagnose cardiovascular diseases." The Revolution APEX CT scanner leverages advanced AI to enhance image quality and enable rapid scanning with motion correction — providing exceptional precision for complex cardiac and routine cases. Its ultra-high resolution is ideal for detailed visualization of cerebral blood vessels and musculoskeletal structures. By capturing larger areas of the body in a single rotation, the system helps to reduce the need for multiple scans and improves diagnostic accuracy with sharper, more precise, images. Additionally, faster scan times and dose-reduction technologies enhance patient safety and comfort, contributing to a more positive overall patient experience. The installation of this leading-edge imaging unit is part of Tampa General's broader commitment to innovation, advanced diagnostics and excellence in patient care. Tampa General's Ferman Family Imaging Center is a hospital-based diagnostic imaging center located at 2 Tampa General Circle in Tampa. For more information, call (813) 844-8288. The Cardiometabolic Disease Prevention Program can be reached at (813) 844-3900 or [email protected]. ABOUT TAMPA GENERAL HOSPITAL Tampa General Hospital, a 981-bed, not-for-profit, academic health system, is one of the largest hospitals in America and delivers world-class care as the region's only center for Level l trauma and comprehensive burn care. Tampa General Hospital is the highest-ranked hospital in the market in U.S. News & World Report's 2024-2025 Best Hospitals, with two medical specialties ranking among the top 20 in the nation and eight medical specialties ranking among the top 50 best hospital programs in the United States. Tampa General Hospital has been designated as a model of excellence by the 2022 Fortune/Merative 100 Top Hospitals list. The academic health system's commitment to growing and developing its team members is recognized by three prestigious Forbes magazine rankings – in the top 100 nationally in the 2024 America's Best Large Employers, the top 50 in Florida in the 2024 America's Best Employers by State and the 2023 America's Best Employers for Women. Tampa General is the safety net hospital for the region, caring for everyone regardless of their ability to pay, and in fiscal year 2023, provided a net community benefit of approximately $301.8 million in the form of health care for underinsured patients, community education, and financial support to community health organizations in Tampa Bay. It was the nation's busiest adult solid organ transplant center in 2024 and is the primary teaching hospital for the USF Health Morsani College of Medicine. With five medical helicopters, Tampa General Hospital transports critically injured or ill patients from 23 surrounding counties to receive the advanced care they need. Tampa General houses a nationally accredited comprehensive stroke center, and its 32-bed Neuroscience, Intensive Care Unit is the largest on the West Coast of Florida. It also is home to the Muma Children's Hospital at TGH, the Jennifer Leigh Muma 82-bed neonatal intensive care unit, and a nationally accredited rehabilitation center. Tampa General Hospital's footprint includes TGH North, which is comprised of three hospitals and several outpatient locations in Citrus and Hernando counties, 17 Tampa General Medical Group Primary Care offices, TGH Family Care Center Kennedy, two TGH Outpatient Centers, TGH Virtual Health, and 19 TGH Imaging outpatient radiology centers throughout Hillsborough, Pasco, Pinellas and Palm Beach counties. Tampa Bay area residents also receive world-class care from the TGH Urgent Care powered by the Fast Track network of clinics. To see a medical care professional live anytime, anywhere on a smartphone, tablet or computer, visit Virtual Health | Tampa General Hospital (tgh.org). As one of the largest hospitals in the country, Tampa General Hospital is the first in Florida to open a clinical command center that provides real-time situational awareness to improve and better coordinate patient care at a lower cost. For more information, go to www.tgh.org. Media Contact: Beth Hardy, APR Assistant Manager Publications & Physician Communications (727) 510-6363 (cell) [email protected] SOURCE Tampa General Hospital
Headline: Tampa General's New Heart Scanners: Faster, Clearer, and a Game Changer for Heart Care
summary: Tampa General Hospital acquired two advanced 512-slice CT scanners, funded by a generous donation, to enhance its cardiac care capabilities.  These AI-powered scanners provide faster, higher-resolution images, improving diagnostic accuracy and patient outcomes for cardiovascular diseases.  The new technology is a cornerstone of the hospital's Cardiometabolic Disease Prevention Program, enabling earlier detection and more personalized treatment plans.
insights:
Key Insights and Takeaways from the Article:

* **Tampa General Hospital (TGH) significantly upgrades its cardiac care capabilities:**  TGH has acquired two state-of-the-art GE Healthcare Revolution APEX 512-Slice CT scanners, representing a substantial investment in advanced diagnostic technology. This was made possible by a donation from the Ferman family.

* **Enhanced speed, resolution, and patient comfort:** The new scanners offer dramatically faster scan times, higher image resolution, and incorporate features designed to improve patient comfort.  These improvements are key to better diagnosis and treatment.

* **AI and machine learning integration:** The technology utilizes AI and machine learning for image reconstruction and motion correction, leading to greater accuracy and precision in diagnoses, particularly of complex cardiovascular conditions.

* **Improved cardiac diagnosis and treatment:** The scanners allow for earlier and more accurate detection of heart disease, enabling cardiologists to develop more personalized and effective treatment plans. This is particularly impactful for the hospital's Cardiometabolic Disease Prevention Program, focusing on early intervention.

* **Broader impact beyond cardiac care:** While the primary focus is on cardiology, the high resolution of the scanners also benefits other areas like visualization of cerebral blood vessels and musculoskeletal structures, potentially improving diagnosis in various specialties.

* **Commitment to innovation and patient care:** The acquisition reflects TGH's dedication to providing world-class diagnostic technology and improving patient outcomes. The investment highlights a broader commitment to innovation and excellence in patient care.

* **Collaborative effort:** The project represents a successful collaboration between TGH's Heart & Vascular Institute, radiology department, and the USF Health Morsani College of Medicine.


In short, the article showcases TGH's significant advancement in diagnostic imaging capabilities, specifically in cardiovascular care, driven by cutting-edge technology and a commitment to improving patient outcomes through early detection and personalized treatment.  The use of AI and the emphasis on patient comfort are also significant aspects of this upgrade.

title: Scientists make intriguing breakthrough in battery technology using laser pulses: 'A critical research subject'
article: "A way to combine these processes into a single step at nanosecond speeds." Lasers are used to perform precise surgeries and have been the weapon of choice for fictional supervillains. Now, experts from Hong Kong University of Science and Technology are using the beams to build advanced batteries, according to a news release. The laser-printing technique has shown potential to accelerate the production of lithium-sulfur packs, a lithium-ion alternative being worked on in labs around the world. Advantages include more energy storage per pound. Sulfur is also nontoxic and is acquired at a lower cost compared to metals used in common batteries. But a shorter lifespan, poor conductivity, and degrading volume expansion have been hurdles, all according to Chinese battery maker UFine. The company isn't involved with the Hong Kong project. University experts have already advanced their laser technique with a simplified approach to make sulfur-based cathodes for pouch and coin cell packs. Ions move between the anode and cathode inside cells during charge/discharge cycles. Current cathode production includes a complex process with varied temperatures. It can be costly and time-consuming, sometimes lasting several days. Laser pulses used as part of a single-step method are showing promise as a much shorter replacement, all per the release. The process involves sulfur, a porous carbon layer, and halloysite-based hybrid nanotubes, serving as the active material, the conducting material, and the host, respectively. The parts are laser printed on a "fabric acceptor," which has "demonstrated outstanding performance in … lithium-sulfur cells," the report added. "Our … technology offers a way to combine these processes into a single step at nanosecond speeds," assistant professor Mitch LI Guijun, who developed the technique, said. A video clip shared by Hong Kong shows a robotic arm moving the rectangular-shaped fabric, which then gets peppered with laser pulses. A pouch cell can be made in 20 minutes and can power a small screen, according to the release. Project first author Yang Rongliang summed up the "thermal phenomenon" caught on camera: "The irradiated materials undergo a complex transient heating and cooling process, with … temperatures reaching up to thousands of degrees Kelvin. The precursor materials decompose, and the decomposed particles recombine to form new materials." Lasers are involved in fascinating tech outside of batteries, as well. Seattle's Carbon Robotics has created a farm machine called LaserWeeder that selectively torches 100,000 weeds an hour with help from artificial intelligence. At the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign, experts are using lasers to turn planet-warming carbon dioxide into cleaner synthetic fuels. It's all part of the way we can use technology to aid the shift to a planet-friendly future. Reduced air pollution will help almost everyone, as the World Health Organization reported that 99% of the population breathes poor air that increases risks for respiratory and other health problems. An easy way to help, part of an overall strategy to save money and cut air pollution at home, is to simply unplug the chargers and devices you aren't using. The energy vampires suck up loads of power, and you can bank $165 annually by pulling the plug. In Hong Kong, the team is confident that its research is based in a critical sector needed to power the future. The sulfur chemistry is also being eyed by vehicle-making juggernaut Stellantis to improve electric vehicle performance, as an example of another effort that could soon make a real-world difference, Reuters reported. "The growing energy demands of modern society have made rechargeable batteries a critical research subject," the university's experts said in an abstract published by Nature. Join our free newsletter for weekly updates on the latest innovations improving our lives and shaping our future, and don't miss this cool list of easy ways to help yourself while helping the planet.
Headline: **Lasers: From Supervillain Weapon to Battery Revolution?**
summary: Researchers at Hong Kong University of Science and Technology have developed a laser-printing technique to significantly accelerate the production of lithium-sulfur batteries.  This single-step process, completed in nanoseconds, combines multiple steps of traditional battery manufacturing, resulting in a faster, cheaper, and potentially more efficient battery alternative. The technique shows promise for improving electric vehicle performance and addressing the growing global energy demands.
insights:
Key Insights and Takeaways from the Article:

* **Laser-Based Battery Production:**  Researchers at Hong Kong University of Science and Technology have developed a laser-printing technique to significantly accelerate the production of lithium-sulfur batteries. This method combines multiple manufacturing steps into a single, nanosecond-speed process.

* **Lithium-Sulfur Battery Advantages:** Lithium-sulfur batteries offer advantages over traditional lithium-ion batteries, including higher energy density (more energy storage per pound), lower cost due to the use of sulfur, and non-toxicity.  However, challenges such as shorter lifespan, poor conductivity, and volume expansion during charging/discharging have hindered their widespread adoption.

* **Improved Cathode Production:** The laser technique focuses on creating improved sulfur-based cathodes.  The process uses a combination of sulfur, porous carbon, and halloysite nanotubes, which are laser-printed onto a fabric acceptor. This simplifies the cathode production process, reducing it from a multi-day, multi-step procedure to a 20-minute process.

* **Speed and Efficiency:** The laser printing process achieves its speed by rapidly heating and cooling the materials to thousands of degrees Kelvin, causing the precursor materials to decompose and recombine into the desired cathode structure.

* **Real-World Applications and Potential:** The technology shows promise for significantly improving the manufacturing of lithium-sulfur batteries, potentially leading to cheaper, more energy-dense batteries for various applications, including electric vehicles (as evidenced by Stellantis' interest).

* **Broader Laser Applications:** The article highlights other innovative uses of lasers, including weed removal in agriculture and the conversion of CO2 into synthetic fuels, demonstrating the versatility of the technology in addressing environmental challenges.

* **Environmental and Economic Benefits:**  The development of improved battery technology and the focus on reducing CO2 emissions contribute to a broader discussion about sustainability, energy efficiency, and the importance of reducing air pollution.  The article even includes a practical tip – unplugging chargers to save energy.


In short, the article highlights a significant advancement in battery technology using laser printing, showcasing its potential to address current limitations of lithium-sulfur batteries and contribute to a more sustainable future.  The technology's speed, efficiency, and potential real-world impact are the main takeaways.

title: 2026 Honda HR-V Launches with Styling and Technology Upgrades
article: 2026 HR-V now includes a 9-inch touchscreen and wireless phone charging as standard features. New exterior styling includes updated wheels, paint colours, and tailgate badging by trim level. Honda Sensing and next-generation airbags are now standard across all trims for enhanced safety coverage. Honda has released the updated 2026 HR-V, featuring new styling and upgraded technology designed to maintain its popularity among younger and first-time vehicle buyers. The refreshed model is now available at Honda dealerships nationwide. Information on the Canadian model is not yet available; however, changes are expected to be very similar. The 2026 HR-V introduces a series of exterior enhancements, including redesigned wheels across all trims. The base LX trim features new Pewter Gray 17-inch alloy wheels, while the Sport trim receives Berlina Black 18-inch wheels. The top-tier EX-L trim now rides on larger machine-finished 18-inch alloy wheels, up from the previous 17-inch size. Two new paint options—Solar Reflection Metallic and Boost Blue Pearl—are also available. Interior updates include a larger 9-inch touchscreen as standard, replacing the previous 7-inch unit. The new infotainment system supports wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto and includes a wireless phone charger as standard. In the EX-L trim, interior lighting enhancements include silver steering wheel spokes, dynamic climate control knob lighting, and new footwell illumination. Rear privacy glass is now standard on all models. The HR-V retains its core equipment, such as a 2.0-litre engine, 7-inch digital instrumentation, and available Real Time All-Wheel Drive with Intelligent Control. Other standard features include fully independent rear suspension, Hill Descent Control, and three drive modes—Normal, Eco, and Snow. All models come equipped with the Honda Sensing suite of safety and driver-assistive technologies. Standard passive safety features include next-generation front airbags, knee airbags for front occupants, and side-impact airbags for rear passengers. The 2025 Honda HR-V LX was priced at $25,400, while the same model sees its price climb to $26,200 in the US. Canadian MSRP for a 2025 HR-V LX stands at $29,960. Expect it to climb by about $1,000 for the 2026 model year.
Headline: 2026 HR-V:  The Upgrade That'll Make You Forget You Ever Wanted a Tesla.
summary: The 2026 Honda HR-V boasts a refreshed design with new wheels, paint colors, and badging, along with upgraded interior features including a standard 9-inch touchscreen and wireless phone charging.  Enhanced safety is a key focus, with next-generation airbags and Honda Sensing standard across all trims.  While US pricing has increased slightly, the updated HR-V is now available at dealerships nationwide.
insights:
Key Insights and Takeaways from the 2026 Honda HR-V Article:

* **Significant Tech Upgrade:** The most notable change is the standard inclusion of a larger 9-inch touchscreen with wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto, along with wireless phone charging.  This significantly enhances the infotainment experience.

* **Enhanced Safety:**  Next-generation airbags (front, knee, and rear side) are now standard across all trims, boosting safety features along with the existing Honda Sensing suite.

* **Refreshed Styling:**  Exterior updates include new wheel designs for all trims, two new paint colors (Solar Reflection Metallic and Boost Blue Pearl), and updated tailgate badging. These changes aim to modernize the vehicle's appearance.

* **Minor Price Increase:** The US price for the base model has increased by approximately $800, and a similar increase is anticipated for the Canadian model.

* **Target Audience Remains:**  Honda aims to retain its popularity among younger and first-time buyers with these upgrades, focusing on technology and safety as key selling points.

* **Canadian Pricing Pending:** While US pricing is available, Canadian MSRP details for the 2026 HR-V are yet to be released but are expected to be similar to the US updates.

* **Core Features Retained:**  The 2.0-liter engine, Real Time All-Wheel Drive (available), and other core features remain, indicating a focus on refinement rather than a complete overhaul.


In short, the 2026 HR-V refresh focuses on enhancing technology, safety, and styling without drastically changing its core identity or significantly increasing the price point in a way likely to deter its target demographic.

title: Unlimited Technology Appoints Sarah Booth as CMO
article: Unlimited Technology, a national leader in integrated security systems and mission-critical infrastructure solutions, announced the appointment of Sarah Booth as chief marketing officer (CMO). Booth’s arrival builds on a deliberate series of leadership investments that have shaped a cohesive executive team and positioned the company for scalable growth and long-term customer success across federal and commercial markets, the announcement states. Booth brings more than 20 years of experience in marketing, strategy and executive leadership across the security and technology sectors, with prior roles at G4S, ADT/Tyco Integrated Security and multiple high-growth SaaS companies. In her new role, she will lead all marketing and communications functions and play a central role in shaping corporate strategy, driving demand and aligning go-to-market execution with the company’s long-term priorities. “Sarah’s energy, experience and customer focus are exactly what we need as we grow,” said John A. Petruzzi Jr., CEO of Unlimited Technology. “As we continue building a unified platform and culture, she’ll help ensure our brand reflects the excellence of our people and the trust our customers place in us.” Booth joins a leadership team shaped under Petruzzi, who became CEO in June 2023. Shortly after stepping into the role, he named Dan Grafton as COO and, in early 2024, appointed Chris Bennett as CFO — key additions that have helped refine the company’s operating model and accelerate performance. Under Petruzzi’s leadership, Unlimited Technology has unified its executive bench and strengthened operational alignment across both sides of the business. Key members of the leadership team include: Bennett , CFO – guiding sustainable performance through finance and M&A , CFO – guiding sustainable performance through finance and M&A Grafton , COO – overseeing operations, service delivery and integration , COO – overseeing operations, service delivery and integration John Palumbo , president, UT Commercial – leading enterprise growth and infrastructure strategy , president, UT Commercial – leading enterprise growth and infrastructure strategy Michael Margolis , president, UT Government – driving mission-critical federal innovation , president, UT Government – driving mission-critical federal innovation Alexander W. Oppenhimer , chief compliance officer – leading legal, ESG and regulatory functions , chief compliance officer – leading legal, ESG and regulatory functions Heath Mabe, SVP of business development – spearheading growth in federal and critical infrastructure markets Together, this leadership team brings decades of security industry experience spanning Fortune 500 companies, federal agencies and high-growth environments. Earlier this year, the company announced that its longtime federal contractor affiliate, Integrated Security Technologies is now doing business as UT Government. The rebrand is part of a broader initiative to streamline operations, clarify regulatory alignment and sharpen focus on services within the government, critical infrastructure and enterprise business sectors. Booth’s appointment follows a series of strategic milestones, including the opening of a new branch in Raleigh, North Carolina, and expanded investment in talent identification, employee retention, recognition and development. “With a strong pipeline and a unified team, we’re on track for another year of customer-driven growth,” said Petruzzi. “That kind of progress doesn’t happen by chance — it happens because of our people. When you invest in the right talent and culture, everything else follows. We’re proud of what we’ve built — and even more excited about what’s ahead.”
Headline: Security Giant Unlimited Technology Scores Marketing All-Star to Fuel Explosive Growth
summary: Unlimited Technology appointed Sarah Booth as its new chief marketing officer, adding to a strengthened executive team assembled under CEO John Petruzzi since June 2023.  Booth's extensive experience in the security and technology sectors will contribute to the company's strategic growth and improved market positioning.  This appointment follows other key leadership hires and a company rebranding, solidifying Unlimited Technology's trajectory for continued expansion.
insights:
Key Insights and Takeaways from the Unlimited Technology Article:

* **Strategic Leadership Investments:** Unlimited Technology has made a concerted effort to build a strong and cohesive executive team under CEO John A. Petruzzi Jr., who took the helm in June 2023.  This includes appointing a new COO, CFO, and now CMO (Sarah Booth).  This team is designed for scalable growth and long-term customer success.

* **Focus on Growth and Market Expansion:** The company is actively pursuing growth in both federal and commercial markets, evidenced by the rebranding of Integrated Security Technologies to UT Government, the opening of a new branch in Raleigh, NC, and Booth's appointment to drive demand generation.

* **Unified Platform and Culture:**  The company emphasizes a unified platform and culture as key to its success.  The executive team's experience and the emphasis on employee retention and development reflect this goal.

* **Customer Focus:**  The article repeatedly highlights a commitment to customer success as a core driver of the company's strategy.

* **Streamlined Operations:**  The rebranding of Integrated Security Technologies and the focus on clarifying regulatory alignment indicate a drive towards streamlined operations and efficiency.

* **Experienced Executive Team:**  The assembled leadership team boasts extensive experience in the security industry, across various sectors (Fortune 500, federal agencies, high-growth environments). This collective expertise positions the company for continued success.

* **Positive Outlook:**  The concluding statement expresses confidence in the company's future growth trajectory, driven by its strong pipeline, unified team, and strategic investments in talent and culture.


In short, the article paints a picture of a company undergoing strategic transformation, focusing on building a strong leadership team, streamlining operations, expanding its market reach, and prioritizing both customer satisfaction and employee development to achieve sustained growth.

title: Comport Appoints Michael Volpi as Vice President of Healthcare Technology
article: Comport Consulting Corp., a trusted partner in delivering innovative technology solutions for the healthcare industry, is pleased to announce the appointment of Mr. Michael Volpi as Vice President of Healthcare Technology. In his new role, Mr. Volpi provides strategic IT guidance to healthcare clients as they plan and execute complex technology initiatives aimed at improving patient care, operational efficiency, and system resilience. Michael Volpi brings a wealth of experience from his 29-year healthcare IT career. His background includes infrastructure and business aspects of EMR’s at Shared Medical Systems (acquired by Siemens Healthcare Services and Cerner Corp.); IT supporting Hospital Operations for a single entity community hospital; and Enterprise IT as Vice President of Technology Services at New Jersey’s largest multi-hospital health system. There he managed a large team of IT professionals and oversaw 25–50 major system-wide technology modernization projects each year, including: Merger and acquisition integrations with significant expansion of ambulatory sites New 8,000 sq. ft. data center & a new Cancer Center supporting both researchers and clinicians Migration and implementation of Epic EMR with a Virtual Desktop TDR A resilient WAN & wireless infrastructure upgrades Organization-wide rollout of Microsoft Office 365 Preparedness for outages and crises At Comport, Michael is committed to using his experience to help other healthcare professionals secure, simplify, and optimize their IT operations. He is adept at translating technology into improved patient care, shorter revenue cycles, error reductions, and stretching IT dollars. He will help with IT strategy, board-level communication as well as desktop and network infrastructure, data center operations, telecommunications, storage and compute solutions, resiliency, and service collaboration and management. “We are thrilled to welcome Michael to the team,” said Mike Vencel, President at Comport. “Michael’s deep knowledge and transformational leadership are tremendous assets for our healthcare clients facing complex challenges. Michael will build upon Comport’s decades of history working with hospitals and further deepen the impact that we provide.” Mr. Volpi is a no-charge resource for healthcare organizations looking to elevate their technology strategies and performance. To schedule a meeting please contact Michael Volpi at www.comport.com/contact. About Comport Founded in 1982, Comport’s mission is to help our clients maximize their competitiveness through digital innovation. We drive successful results by investing in the best people including a high ratio of engineering staff, thought leadership, and a portfolio of the most highly regarded technology and solution partnerships. Comport supports multiple verticals including Healthcare, Financial Services and Manufacturing for data center initiatives. ComportSecure is our Cloud, Managed & Professional Services division and includes Subject Matter Experts for Security and MS initiatives. Years of best practices and a highly vested ‘go the extra-mile’ culture foster long-term and new relationships. We believe in listening, integrity, ownership, and excellence.
Headline: Healthcare IT Veteran Joins Comport:  Is Your System Ready for the Future?
summary: Comport Consulting Corp. appointed Michael Volpi as its new Vice President of Healthcare Technology.  Volpi brings 29 years of healthcare IT experience, including leadership roles at major health systems, to provide strategic IT guidance and support to Comport's clients.  He will help healthcare organizations improve patient care, operational efficiency, and system resilience through optimized IT strategies.
insights:
Key Insights and Takeaways from the Comport Consulting Corp. Press Release:

* **Comport hires a highly experienced healthcare IT veteran:** Michael Volpi, with a 29-year career in healthcare IT, joins Comport as Vice President of Healthcare Technology.  His extensive experience spans various roles and organizational sizes, from single hospitals to large multi-hospital systems.

* **Volpi's expertise is broad and impactful:** His skills encompass all aspects of healthcare IT, including EMR implementation (specifically Epic), infrastructure management (data centers, networks, WAN), cybersecurity, IT strategy, and operational efficiency improvements. He's shown success in managing large-scale projects and navigating mergers and acquisitions.

* **Comport strengthens its healthcare offerings:**  Volpi's addition significantly enhances Comport's ability to serve healthcare clients.  It signals a commitment to deepening their expertise and market position within the healthcare IT sector.

* **Value proposition for healthcare organizations:**  Volpi offers a valuable, no-charge resource for healthcare organizations seeking to improve their IT strategies and performance.  This includes help with everything from strategic planning and board-level communication to hands-on technical support.

* **Comport's overall approach:** The press release highlights Comport's focus on digital innovation, investment in top talent, and a commitment to long-term client relationships built on integrity and excellence.  Their emphasis on a high ratio of engineering staff suggests a hands-on, solutions-oriented approach.


In short, the press release announces a significant hire that strengthens Comport's capabilities and expands its value proposition to healthcare clients facing complex IT challenges.  Volpi's expertise positions Comport to offer comprehensive and impactful IT solutions.

title: Google I/O 2025: From research to reality
article: Project Mariner → Agent Mode We think of agents as systems that combine the intelligence of advanced AI models with access to tools, so they can take actions on your behalf and under your control. Our early research prototype, Project Mariner, is an early step forward in agents with computer-use capabilities to interact with the web and get stuff done for you. We released it as an early research prototype in December, and we’ve made a lot of progress since with new multitasking capabilities — and a method called “teach and repeat,” where you can show it a task once and it learns plans for similar tasks in the future. We're bringing Project Mariner’s computer use capabilities to developers via the Gemini API. Trusted testers like Automation Anywhere and UiPath are already starting to build with it, and it will be available more broadly this summer. Computer use is part of a broader set of tools we’ll need to build for an agent ecosystem to flourish. Like our open Agent2Agent Protocol, so that agents can talk to each other, or the Model Context Protocol introduced by Anthropic, so agents can access other services. And today, we're excited to announce that our Gemini API and SDK are now compatible with MCP tools. We’re also starting to bring agentic capabilities to Chrome, Search and in the Gemini app. For example, a new Agent Mode in the Gemini app will help you get even more done. If you’re apartment hunting, it will help find listings that match your criteria on websites like Zillow, adjust filters and use MCP to access the listings and even schedule a tour for you. An experimental version of Agent Mode in the Gemini app will be coming soon to subscribers. And it’s great for companies like Zillow, bringing in new customers and improving conversion rates. This is a new and emerging area, and we’re excited to explore how best to bring the benefits of agents to users and the ecosystem more broadly.
Headline: **Your AI Assistant Just Got Superpowers: Introducing Gemini Agent Mode**
summary: Google's Project Mariner, an AI agent capable of web interaction and task completion, is being integrated into the Gemini API and app.  This agent utilizes a "teach and repeat" learning method and will soon feature an "Agent Mode" for tasks like apartment hunting, leveraging tools like MCP for enhanced functionality.  The company is expanding its agent ecosystem through collaborations and open protocols to foster broader development and adoption.
insights:
Key insights and takeaways from the article about Project Mariner and Agent Mode:

* **Agent technology is advancing:** Google is developing agent technology (Project Mariner) that combines AI with tool access to perform tasks on behalf of users.  This goes beyond simple AI models and involves actual interaction with the real world via tools and APIs.

* **Project Mariner is maturing:** Initially a research prototype, Mariner now boasts enhanced multitasking and a "teach and repeat" learning mechanism, making it more efficient and adaptable.

* **Developer access via Gemini API:** Google is making Mariner's computer-use capabilities available to developers via its Gemini API, enabling third-party integrations and app development.

* **Agent ecosystem development:** Google is investing in the broader agent ecosystem, including inter-agent communication (Agent2Agent Protocol) and integration with other services like Anthropic's Model Context Protocol (MCP).  This signifies a push towards a collaborative and interoperable agent landscape.

* **Agent Mode in Gemini App:**  A key application of this technology is the upcoming Agent Mode within Google's Gemini app. This allows users to automate complex tasks like apartment hunting, leveraging web scraping, filter adjustment, and service access via MCP.

* **Broader impact and benefits:** The technology benefits both users (through task automation) and businesses (like Zillow, through increased customer engagement and conversion rates).

* **Early stages, but promising:** The article emphasizes that agent technology is still emerging, but Google is actively exploring and expanding its capabilities and integration with existing services.  The focus is on responsible and beneficial deployment.

title: By putting AI into everything, Google wants to make it invisible
article: Yes, Google’s roster of consumer-facing products is the slickest on offer. The firm is bundling most of its multimodal models into its Gemini app, including the new Imagen 4 image generator and the new Veo 3 video generator. That means you can now access Google’s full range of generative models via a single chatbot. It also announced Gemini Live, a feature that lets you share your phone’s screen or your camera’s view with the chatbot and ask it about what it can see. Those features were previously only seen in demos of Project Astra, a “universal AI assistant“ that Google DeepMind is working on. Now, Google is inching toward putting Project Astra into the hands of anyone with a smartphone. Google is also rolling out AI Mode, an LLM-powered front end to search. This can now pull in personal information from Gmail or Google Docs to tailor searches to users. It will include Deep Search, which can break a query down into hundreds of individual searches and then summarize the results; a version of Project Mariner, Google DeepMind’s browser-using agent; and Search Live, which lets you hold up your camera and ask it what it sees. This is the new frontier. It’s no longer about who has the most powerful models, but who can spin them into the best products. OpenAI’s ChatGPT includes many similar features to Gemini’s. But with its existing ecosystem of consumer services and billions of existing users, Google has a clear advantage. Power users wanting access to the latest versions of everything on display can now sign up for Google AI Ultra for $250 a month. When OpenAI released ChatGPT in late 2022, Google was caught on the back foot and was forced to jump into higher gear to catch up. With this year’s product lineup, it looks as if Google has stuck its landing. On a preview call, CEO Sundar Pichai claimed that AI Overviews, a precursor to AI Mode that provides LLM-generated summaries of search results, had turned out to be popular with hundreds of millions of users. He speculated that many of them may not even know (or care) that they were using AI—it was just a cool new way to search. Google I/O gives a broader glimpse of that future, one where AI is invisible. “More intelligence is available, for everyone, everywhere,” Pichai told his audience. I think we are expected to marvel. But by putting AI in everything, Google is turning AI into a technology we won’t notice and may not even bother to name.
Headline: Google's AI Takeover:  Invisible, Ubiquitous, and Utterly Unstoppable?
summary: Google is integrating its advanced AI models, including Imagen 4 and Veo 3, into its Gemini app, offering a single interface for accessing various generative AI features like live screen and camera interactions.  They're also launching AI Mode for search, incorporating personalized data and advanced search capabilities, aiming to seamlessly integrate AI into existing services.  This strategy, unlike OpenAI's more standalone approach, leverages Google's existing user base and ecosystem for a broader reach, making AI features subtly integrated rather than explicitly noticeable.
insights:
Key insights and takeaways from the article:

* **Google's strategic shift from model power to product integration:**  The article highlights Google's focus on integrating its powerful AI models (like Gemini) into user-friendly products rather than solely emphasizing raw model performance.  This is presented as a key differentiator from competitors like OpenAI.

* **Gemini app as a central hub for multimodal AI:** Google is consolidating its various generative AI capabilities (image generation, video generation, etc.) within the Gemini app, providing a single access point for users.  This contrasts with a more fragmented approach from some competitors.

* **Seamless integration with existing Google services:** Leveraging its vast ecosystem of services (Search, Gmail, Docs), Google is embedding AI functionality directly into existing workflows, making AI less of a separate tool and more of an invisible assistant.  This is a major advantage over companies without established user bases and ecosystems.

* **Project Astra's progress towards consumer availability:** Features previously showcased only in demos of Google DeepMind's Project Astra (a universal AI assistant) are now being integrated into consumer products like Gemini, indicating progress towards a broader rollout.

* **AI Mode as a revolutionary search experience:**  AI Mode, incorporating features like Deep Search and Search Live, represents a significant upgrade to Google Search, using LLMs to personalize and streamline information retrieval.

* **Google's successful response to OpenAI's ChatGPT:** The article suggests that Google's initial hesitation in the face of ChatGPT's launch has been overcome, with its recent product releases demonstrating a strong comeback.  The success of AI Overviews (a precursor to AI Mode) is cited as evidence.

* **The future of AI: Invisible and ubiquitous:** Google's vision is presented as one where AI is seamlessly integrated into everyday life, becoming so ubiquitous that users may not even realize they're interacting with it.  This "invisible AI" approach is framed as a key strategic goal.

* **Premium access for power users:** The introduction of Google AI Ultra (a paid tier) caters to users demanding access to the latest and most advanced AI features.


In short, the article portrays Google as shifting its focus from a competition based solely on AI model capabilities to a race for the best *integration* of AI into everyday user experiences.  Its existing infrastructure and user base are positioned as key competitive advantages.

title: The construction of Xinan Technology's Power Control and ESS Core Components Intelligent Manufacturing Project has commenced! | SMM
article: Recently, the groundbreaking ceremony for the Xinan Technology Intelligent Manufacturing Project of Power Control and Energy Storage Core Components was held in Binhu District, Wuxi City. The project, invested and constructed by Wuxi Xinan Technology Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as "Xinan Technology"), has a total investment exceeding 500 million yuan. The commencement of the project marks a significant achievement in Xinan Technology's in-depth layout within the new energy industry chain. Since its establishment in 1994, Xinan Technology has been deeply engaged in the automotive parts business for over three decades , with automotive turbocharger parts as its core product. It has also actively participated in the R&D and manufacturing of precision parts for NEV motors, gearbox casings, and more. The new project, which has just commenced, will focus on producing core components for fuel cell stacks and medium-voltage power supply systems, with products widely applied inNEVs, rail transit, urban infrastructure construction, and big data centers, among other fields. Xinan Technology holds significant technological advantages inthe field of lightweight aluminum alloy automotive parts, possessing various advanced aluminum alloy forming processes such as gravity casting, low-pressure casting, and die casting. In the domestic market, the company actively expands new businesses and increases market share; in overseas markets, it accelerates the construction of overseas production capacity,with Thailand as a key battleground for overseas capacity layout. It has established a subsidiary in Thailand to implement the construction of a Thai factory, using Thailand as a hub to deeply cultivate the Southeast Asian market and further enhance the company's international competitiveness among clients. Meanwhile, on June 16-17, 2025, Xinan Technology will participate in the2025 SMM 2nd Southeast Asia Automotive Supply Chain Conferenceorganized by SMM Information & Technology Co., Ltd. (SMM) in Bangkok, Thailand. We look forward to seeing you atBooth A07!
